page.title: 02SWALE BOROUGH COUNCIL
page.content: In 1974 the Swale Borough Council superceded the Sittingbourne and Milton Council.It encompassed 5 other authorities.Harry White,chief executive since 1979,said his most important job was to keep both Swale people happy and the council's employees content.The most important jobs of the council are:housing;the road network;road resurfacing; investing money and planning for new building.The problem of housing brings most public complaints.Swale owns roughly 10,000 houses but there is a waiting list of about 400 people. Vandalism is costly but Swale has less than many areas.Unemployment is relatively low.Council members regret that the public use their right to listen in during council meetings.The Mayor has an important public relations role.
